item.title: By: Ruth
item.dc:creator: Ruth
item.description: Anita, have just discovered your blog. WOW, so entertaining and informative! Auntie Google led me here whilst researching the possibility of making a crochembouche for my son's wedding arvo tea prior to reception. But I think I'll make more than one. There are 250 guests!! Fortunately the wedding isn't until Feb '13. Hey, have you got any great ideas for other French provincial inspired goodies?
item.content:encoded: Anita, have just discovered your blog. WOW, so entertaining and informative! Auntie Google led me here whilst researching the possibility of making a crochembouche for my son’s wedding arvo tea prior to reception. But I think I’ll make more than one. There are 250 guests!! Fortunately the wedding isn’t until Feb ’13. Hey, have you got any great ideas for other French provincial inspired goodies?

item.title: By: Ianna
item.dc:creator: Ianna
item.description: Hi, even though I don't know who you are, I really want to thank you. As you sorted out my questions. haha. I was thinking about how much does the Masterchef recipe made, and you told me. I was worrying how many egg gives 330g egg yolks and you told me. =D really thank you very much, you got your croquembouche, it's now my turn to try and make them =)
item.content:encoded: Hi, even though I don’t know who you are, I really want to thank you. As you sorted out my questions. haha. I was thinking about how much does the Masterchef recipe made, and you told me. I was worrying how many egg gives 330g egg yolks and you told me. =D really thank you very much, you got your croquembouche, it’s now my turn to try and make them =)

item.title: By: Linda
item.dc:creator: Linda
item.description: OMG this looks amazing thank you so much for posting your ideas as I haven't been game enough to try it. Can you please tell me without using the cone tin do you just stack them on top of each other so that its not hollow in the middle of the cone as such?? And roughly how many puffs are there in your croquembouche.
item.content:encoded: OMG this looks amazing thank you so much for posting your ideas as I haven’t been game enough to try it. Can you please tell me without using the cone tin do you just stack them on top of each other so that its not hollow in the middle of the cone as such?? And roughly how many puffs are there in your croquembouche.

item.title: By: Saadiya
item.dc:creator: Saadiya
item.description: Hi Anita! This was just what I was looking for after being inspired my Masterchef too... thanks for your tips, I am attempting it this weekend (at a quarter of the quantity though)!
item.content:encoded: Hi Anita! This was just what I was looking for after being inspired my Masterchef too… thanks for your tips, I am attempting it this weekend (at a quarter of the quantity though)!

item.title: By: Anita
item.dc:creator: Anita
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/croquembouche/comment-page-1/#comment-2823">Eliduh</a>.
Hi Eliduh It took a lot longer than 90 minutes for me. Although I wasn't rushing or multi-tasking as much as I could have. If you have the chance I would recommend making the pastry cream the night before, or making a smaller quantity of everything. Good luck! Anita
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Eliduh.

Hi Eliduh
It took a lot longer than 90 minutes for me. Although I wasn’t rushing or multi-tasking as much as I could have. If you have the chance I would recommend making the pastry cream the night before, or making a smaller quantity of everything.
Good luck!
Anita

item.title: By: Eliduh
item.dc:creator: Eliduh
item.description: How long did the croquembouche to make because I only have 90 minutes to make it.
item.content:encoded: How long did the croquembouche to make because I only have 90 minutes to make it.

item.title: By: Jackie
item.dc:creator: Jackie
item.description: Please can you tell me if i make this the night before do i store in the fridge overnight and will it still be as yummy and also how do transport such a big cake?
